details.title: TINY, a DREB-like transcription factor binding to DRE element
details.abstract: TINY isolated through a transposon-mutagenesis experiment designed to recover dominant gain-of-function alleles in Arabidopsis encodes a protein containing a putative DNA-binding domain which is conserved in AP2/EREBP transcription factors of plants. AP2/EREBP transcription factors play a variety of regulatory roles in several developmental processes and in response to biotic and environmental stresses. Using the yeast one-hybrid analysis system, we demonstrated that TINY could furction as a DREB-like transcription factor specifically binding to the dehydration-responsive element (DRE) cis-acting element.
